intro: Pavetta bourdillonii, commonly known as the African pavetta, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with five lobes, and are arranged in clusters at the ends of branches. Pavetta bourdillonii is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along riverbanks.
